content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>20150311</pubdate> <title Sync="TRUE">Outer Continental Shelf Official Protraction Diagrams - Atlantic Region NAD 83</title> <geoform Sync="TRUE">vector digital data</geoform> <serinfo> <sername>Digital Offshore Cadastre</sername> <issue>current</issue> </serinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Herndon, Virginia</pubplace> <publish>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management,  Mapping and Boundary Branch</publish> </pubinfo> <onlink>http://www.boem.gov/Oil-and-Gas-Energy-Program/Mapping-and-Data/ATL_PROTCLP(3).aspx</onlink> <onlink>http://www.boem.gov/Oil-and-Gas-Energy-Program/Mapping-and-Data/Atlantic.aspx</onlink> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>20101005</pubdate> <title>BOEM Offshore Cadastral Data</title> <geoform>map</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Herndon, Virginia</pubplace> <publish>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</publish> </pubinfo> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract> This data set contains Official Protraction Diagram (OPD) outlines in ESRI shapefile format.  Atlantic Region OPDs are approximately 2 degrees wide by one degree high.  OPDs are further subdivided into blocks that are 4800 x 4800 meters on a UTM plane (but this file does not include those blocks - only the OPD outline).  Where the OPD hits the UTM zone boundary, that zone boundary will be a geodesic line - which will appear slightly curved on the UTM plane.  OPDs are numbered using the United Nations International Map of the World Numbering System, and are generally named for land or hydrographic features contained within the limits of the diagram.  These OPD outlines were clipped along the Submerged Lands Act Boundary (3 mile line), Continental Shelf Boundary (international boundaries), and the dividing line between the Gulf and Atlantic Regions.  Further information on the historic development of OPD's can be found in OCS Report MMS 99-0006: Boundary Development on the Outer Continental Shelf: http://www.boemre.gov/itd/pubs/1999/99-0006.pdf Because GIS projection and topology functions can change or generalize coordinates, these GIS files are considered to be approximate and are NOT an OFFICIAL record for the exact OPD coordinates or areas. The Official Protraction Diagrams (OPDs) and Supplemental Official Block Diagrams (SOBDs), available on the web in pdf format, serve as the legal definition for BOEM offshore boundary coordinates and area descriptions. </abstract> <purpose>Cadastre information the BOEM produces are generated in accordance with 30 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 256.8 to support Federal land ownership and mineral resource management.</purpose> <supplinf>The BOEM is making its existing cadastre data available at http://www.boem.gov/Oil-and-Gas-Energy-Program/Mapping-and-Data/Index.aspx These data include Official Protraction Diagrams (OPDs), and Supplemental Official OCS Block Diagrams (SOBDs) in pdf format, and digital spatial data in ArcGIS shapefile format.</supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.6.1500</native> <crossref> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>2001-2010</pubdate> <title>Supplemental Official OCS Block Diagrams (SOBDs)</title> <edition>current version</edition> <geoform>diagram</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Herndon, Virginia</pubplace> <publish>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</publish> </pubinfo> <othercit> SOBDs contain official coordinate and area descriptions for individual blocks. </othercit> <onlink>http://www.boem.gov/Oil-and-Gas-Energy-Program/Mapping-and-Data/Atlantic.aspx</onlink> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>2001-2010</pubdate> <title>BOEM Offshore Cadastral Data</title> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </crossref> <crossref> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>2001-2010</pubdate> <title>Official Protraction Diagrams (OPDs)</title> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Herndon, Virginia</pubplace> <publish>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</publish> </pubinfo> <othercit> Atlantic Region OPDs show the OCS blocks for an area approximately two degrees wide and one degree high. </othercit> <onlink>http://www.boem.gov/Oil-and-Gas-Energy-Program/Mapping-and-Data/Atlantic.aspx</onlink> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management</origin> <pubdate>2001-2010</pubdate> <title>BOEM Offshore Cadastral Data</title> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </crossref> </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>The file is believed to be free of topologic errors.</logic> <complete>Clipped outlines for all Atlantic OPDs are included.</complete> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar> Coordinates values have been computed to .00000001 of a degree, but this shapefile is considered to be approximate.  Where differences occur between the shapefile and the OPD and SOBD diagrams, the diagrams take precidence. This shapefile was created by extracting the X-Y UTM coordinates from the TIMS database.  In order to create this Regional shapefile, which spans multiple UTM zones, all coordinates were re-projected to a single UTM zone (Zone 18).  This file was then re-projected to geographic for distribution purposes.  This resulted in some distortion (up to 0.009 meters) at the far East and West edges of the shapefile. </horizpar> </horizpa> </posacc> <lineage> <srcinfo> <srccite> <citeinfo> <origin>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</origin> <pubdate>1996-2008</pubdate> <title>BOEM Technical Information Management System</title> <geoform>Database</geoform> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Herndon, Virginia</pubplace> <publish>Bureau of Ocean Energy Management, Mapping and Boundary Branch</publish> </pubinfo> </citeinfo> </srccite> <typesrc>Database</typesrc> <srctime> <timeinfo> <rngdates> <begdate>1996</begdate> <enddate>2008</enddate> </rngdates> </timeinfo> <srccurr>publication date</srccurr> </srctime> <srccitea>TIMS</srccitea> <srccontr>Coordinates and attributes for OPD polygons.</srccontr> </srcinfo> <procstep> <procdesc> In house programs were used to protract offshore blocks OPD by OPD, on a UTM grid for the offshore areas. Additional boundaries, including the Submerged Lands Act boundary, the Continental Shelf boundary, and others were also computed and intersected with the OPD blocks. The resulting points were then stored in the TIMS database.  Other in-house programs were used to create an ArcInfo Coverage from the data stored in the TIMS database.  That coverage was converted into a shapefile (AT_SUBBLK.SHP) using ArcGIS.  Portions of blocks outside federal jurisdiction were removed, and the shapefile was further "dissolved" to yeild just the clipped OPD outlines. </procdesc> <procdate>2006</procdate> <proccont>
